channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title: ♦️ 美国政府再次避免停摆。♦️ 唐纳德-特朗普的豁免权要求将提交最高法院。♦️ 米奇-麦康奈尔将于11月卸任共和党参议院领袖。关注美国政治最新动态： 👇
item.description:
♦️ America’s government avoids a shutdown, again.

♦️ Donald Trump’s immunity claim will go to the Supreme Court.

♦️ Mitch McConnell will step down as Republican Senate leader in November.

Follow the latest in American politics: https://t.co/ey9AYHzgAQ 👇 pic.twitter.com/LYWR2KmEha

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 29, 2024

item.title: 这六本书有助于解释中东一个世纪的暴力事件 👇
item.description:
These six books help explain a century of violence in the Middle East https://t.co/6luXMxcpSY 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 29, 2024

item.title: 为什么北约对美国人重要？关于 "制衡"： @Gottemoeller 为北约辩护🎧 一个创始国退出北约🎧 我们的副主编谈唐纳德-特朗普的言论
item.description:
Why should NATO matter to Americans? On “Checks and Balance”: https://t.co/RIKKrIx8eE

🎧 @Gottemoeller defends the alliance
🎧 When a founding member stepped back from NATO
🎧 Our deputy editor on Donald Trump’s comments

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 29, 2024

item.title: 为了寻找援助乌克兰的资金来源，西方政客们把目光投向了已被冻结两年、价值 2,600 亿欧元的俄罗斯资产。他们不应该没收这些资产，但他们可以充分利用这些资产👇。
item.description:
In search of a source of funding to provide aid for Ukraine, Western politicians have settled their eyes on assets worth €260bn belonging to Russia that have been frozen for two years. They should not seize them—but they can exploit them to the full https://t.co/E1BdKaZRAq 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 29, 2024

item.title: 2021 年，佛罗里达州和得克萨斯州的共和党立法机构通过了法律，试图约束 Facebook 和 Twitter 等网站对反疫苗活动家和叛乱分子的排挤。但最高法院对这一问题持谨慎态度
item.description:
In 2021 Republican legislatures in Florida and Texas passed laws seeking to rein in sites like Facebook and Twitter for sidelining anti-vaccine activists and insurrectionists.

Two industry groups quickly sued. But the Supreme Court is wary on the issue https://t.co/WjKAmyEegl

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 29, 2024

item.title: 股市正在飙升。但它们能涨多高？即使人工智能也不太可能重现过去十年的表现
item.description:
Stockmarkets are soaring. But how high can they go? Even AI is unlikely to drive a repeat of the past decade’s performance https://t.co/rMeXa8fQMT pic.twitter.com/DQ2LBV3Tyg

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 29, 2024

item.title: Nvidia 主导着人工智能芯片制造。任何希望取代这家半导体巨头的竞争对手都需要在三大领域击败它。请阅读这将是一项艰巨任务的原因： 👇
item.description:
Nvidia dominates AI chipmaking. Any competitor hoping to displace the semiconductor behemoth will need to beat it in three big areas.

Read why that will be a tall order: https://t.co/eOGUIkaBeG 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 29, 2024

item.title: 性问题会毁掉人的一生。然而，补救措施往往很简单👇。
item.description:
Sexual problems can wreck lives. Yet remedies are often simple https://t.co/3eFtdFs19b 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 29, 2024

item.title: 非洲正在像其他任何大陆一样，与敌对势力周旋。非洲领导人需要在巨大的机遇和严峻的风险之间取得平衡 👇。
item.description:
Africa is juggling rival powers like no other continent. Its leaders need to balance vast opportunities against dire risks https://t.co/P1AX7yucTI 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 29, 2024

item.title: 您是巧克力爱好者吗？您可能已经注意到，您的习惯已经变得越来越昂贵。原因如下 🍫
item.description:
Are you a chocoholic? You may have noticed that your habit has become pricier. Here’s why https://t.co/jXThCbCXkC 🍫

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 29, 2024

item.title: 发音、重音和节奏很少有人教得好 👇
item.description:
Pronunciation, stress and rhythm are rarely taught well https://t.co/hkzZ5JpnNH 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 29, 2024

item.title: 社交媒体正在经历一场深刻却鲜为人知的变革。令人震惊的是，社交媒体不再具有社交属性。潮流正在转向 👇
item.description:
Social media are undergoing a profound but little-noticed transformation. Strikingly, they are no longer very social. The tide is turning https://t.co/NJKlGjnTH9 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 29, 2024

item.title: 三本书解释了为什么它很重要--而且很容易丢失 👇
item.description:
Three books explain why it matters—and can easily be lost https://t.co/Brp4pVBfUd 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 29, 2024

item.title: 当塔利班在阿富汗重新掌权时，娜杰拉-穆拉迪意识到她的朋友、邻居和同事中有多少人一直站在塔利班一边。她可能会受到严厉的惩罚
item.description:
When the Taliban retook power in Afghanistan, Najela Muradi realised how many of her friends, neighbours and colleagues were on their side all along.

It would only take one to report her for secretly teaching girls. The punishment would probably be severe https://t.co/UKzSqiwiEg

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 29, 2024

item.title: 与基辅、敖德萨和其他大城市不同，哈尔科夫在战争中遭受了明显的破坏。房屋和商店的窗户仍然被木板封住。该省的一些农村地区还在勉强支撑👇。
item.description:
Unlike Kyiv, Odessa and other big cities, Kharkiv is visibly battered by the war. The windows of homes and shops remain boarded up. Some rural parts of the province are barely hanging on https://t.co/rtfaeY3sf2 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 29, 2024

item.title: 法国与其他国家不同。它拥有核武器，高度集权，将非同寻常的权力集中在一个人手中。
item.description:
France is not a country like any other. It is nuclear-armed, highly centralised and concentrates unusual powers in the hands of a single person.

Any complacency about the prospect of a Marine Le Pen presidency would be wrong https://t.co/UKA3eGx1mV 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 29, 2024

item.title: 在卢拉担任总统之前，巴西曾是国际上的弃儿。现在，巴西与西方的关系正在愈合，但巴西需要决定自己要走的道路👇。
item.description:
Prior to Lula’s presidency, Brazil was something of a international pariah. Relationships with the West are now healing, but the country needs to decide what path it is forging https://t.co/uAxDQyl77Q 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 29, 2024

item.title: 2021 年 7 月，弗拉基米尔-普京（Vladimir Putin）发表了一篇文章，在 1000 年的历史长河中狂奔，声称俄罗斯人和乌克兰人是一个民族。这七张地图展示了他对过去的歪曲 👇。
item.description:
In July 2021 Vladimir Putin published an essay that raced through 1,000 years of history to argue that Russians and Ukrainians are one people. These seven maps demonstrate his distortion of the past https://t.co/8tES6YJ0W3 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 29, 2024

item.title: 阿列克谢-纳瓦尔尼深知自己行为的后果。他走进监狱是为了消除监狱带来的恐惧，并以此将人民从麻痹中解放出来。
item.description:
Alexei Navalny understood the consequence of his actions. He walked into prison to strike at the fear it instils and, in so doing, liberate his people from paralysis.

1843 magazine explores the historical and cultural foundations of Russia’s penal system https://t.co/QGme1KcMDZ

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 29, 2024

item.title: 法国的强硬右翼政党国民集结党正在换挡。在巴黎举行的静悄悄的会议上，该党官员和当选议员正在收集从市场风险到能源政策等各方面的意见，因为他们将目光瞄准了总统职位👇。
item.description:
France’s hard-right National Rally party is changing gear.

In quiet meetings in Paris, party officials and elected deputies are gathering input on everything from market risk to energy policy as they sets their sights on the presidency https://t.co/mz3m38Cqqo 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 29, 2024

item.title: 在国内，中国共产党通过让人民了解国家的近况来确保自我审查。这一强有力的工具现在也在国外使用 👇。
item.description:
At home, the Chinese Communist Party ensures self-censorship by keeping people aware of the state’s proximity. This powerful tool is now in use abroad, too https://t.co/6142u2dBTx 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 29, 2024

item.title: "达荷美 "是 Mati Diop 制作的一部引人入胜的纪录片，讲述了 26 件艺术品 2021 年从巴黎运往贝宁最大城市科托努的过程，这是前殖民国家首次大规模归还被掠夺的非洲艺术品 👇 。
item.description:
“Dahomey”, a captivating documentary by Mati Diop, follows the journey of 26 artefacts from Paris to Cotonou, Benin’s largest city, in 2021, in what was the first major restitution of looted African art by a former colonial power https://t.co/a3erVYiy4R 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 29, 2024

item.title: "尤瓦尔-诺亚-哈拉里（Yuval Noah Harari）在一篇特约文章中谈到人工智能时说："我们刚刚在地球上遇到了一种外星智能。"我们对它知之甚少，只知道它可能会毁灭我们的文明。
item.description:
“We have just encountered an alien intelligence, here on Earth,” Yuval Noah Harari says of AI in a guest essay. “We don’t know much about it, except that it might destroy our civilisation” https://t.co/btB5VInga9 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 29, 2024

item.title: 牛肉每卡路里食物排放的二氧化碳是豆腐的 31 倍。人类烹饪这么多牛，也是在烹饪自己。放弃牛排可能是减少我们碳足迹的最有效方法之一👇。
item.description:
Beef emits 31 times more CO₂ per calorie of food than tofu does. By cooking so many cows, humans are cooking themselves, too. Forgoing steaks may be one of the most efficient ways to reduce our carbon footprint https://t.co/f1JVunSXWi 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 29, 2024

item.title: 随着精神疾病的增加，越来越多的科学家正在研究营养如何影响大脑。食物影响心理，也影响身体 👇
item.description:
With mental-health disorders rising, a growing number of scientists are investigating how nutrition influences the brain. Food affects the mind, as well as the body https://t.co/NXfjzDAQNE 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 29, 2024

item.title: 在电子表格之间跳转。这是管理顾问的爱与性指南 👇
item.description:
Jump between the spreadsheets. This is the management consultant’s guide to love and sex https://t.co/z6aKVRXBMR 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 29, 2024

item.title: 通过数字分组来解释历史正在流行。列表式文章承诺，历史可以被分解和理解，五件（或 100 件）事情就是你需要知道的全部： 实际数字可能有所不同图片：盖蒂图片社
item.description:
Explaining history through numerical groupings is in vogue. Listicles promise that history can be broken down and understood, and that five (or 100) things is all you need to know: https://t.co/p2svoIw8hx

* Actual numbers may vary

Image: Getty Images pic.twitter.com/RQXUaB5ggA

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 29, 2024

item.title: Mistral 推出了最新的大型语言模型，并与微软达成了协议。我们来认识一下这家希望与 OpenAI 👇一较高下的法国初创公司。
item.description:
Mistral has unveiled its latest large language model—and a deal with Microsoft. We meet the French startup hoping to take on OpenAI https://t.co/0mvBc9LyfL 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 29, 2024

item.title: 由于制造商提价，巧克力销量下降。现在，该行业正面临着一场惨痛的清算👇。
item.description:
Chocolate sales are down as manufacturers raise prices. Now the industry is facing a bitter reckoning https://t.co/9ndfcYsFt3 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 28, 2024

item.title: @imkahloon 说，即使唐纳德-特朗普没有让美国退出北约，"他也可以做很多事情来破坏 "这个联盟。在 "制衡 "节目中，您将看到这究竟是什么。
item.description:
Even if Donald Trump didn’t take America out of NATO “there’s quite a lot he could do to disrupt” the alliance, says @imkahloon. Find out what that is, on “Checks and Balance” https://t.co/XJs8X1iBjl 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) February 28, 2024
